summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview of Daniel, a Communications Technician at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, conducted on April 7, 2022. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memorandum lists attachments including the interview transcript and related emails and documents concerning camera systems and facility issues at MCC New York from 2018-2019.

keyFacts: The document is part of the official OIG investigation into the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein.
A BOP Communications Technician named Daniel was interviewed on April 7, 2022, regarding Epstein's time at MCC New York.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, and the memorandum lists ten attachments including emails and memos about camera systems and facility issues at MCC New York from 2018-2019.
The attachments suggest the investigation is examining technical and operational details, such as camera systems and communications, at the facility where Epstein died.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is for limited official use only.
